Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the finance, marketing, and product teams, your focus will be on deriving insights from the group data warehouse to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize our technology stack (Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, and Superset) to derive insights from the group data warehouse.
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and actionable insights.
Build visualizations and storytelling frameworks to present data in an engaging and understandable manner.
Understand and analyze core e-commerce KPIs to support business objectives.
Ensure data stewardship and the delivery of accurate and reliable data analysis.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



Bonus Skills / If you know some of this, even better


Experience using Python, specifically creating Airflow DAGs.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control (GIT).



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

Title: Business Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2014, we at Haensel AMS are an international, Berlin based, technology & data analytics solution provider. We develop, apply and implement cutting-edge math techniques and ML methods in various industry projects, thereby significantly contributing to the commercial success of our clients. We work very closely with our clients and our main internal KPI for success is that our solutions are in daily use by them. Our mission is to bring day-2-day data-driven decisions to every company.




We have successfully managed steady growth over the past 10 years and want to continue our growth curve in the EU und US. We embrace innovation and are proud to have a dynamic, team focused culture.




We are an equal rights employer, with flat hierarchies and a focus on the team. Our values are team spirit, willingness to learn and constant improvement, honesty, trust, taking initiative and ownership, and last but not least having fun.




If this excites you as much as us, then we would love to hear from you!




We are looking for:

Business Intelligence & Data Analyst (f/m/d)




What we are looking for in your CV:

You have a good command of SQL, ideally in various dialects like Snowflake, BigQuery, Athena, MySQL
You have strong spreadsheet skills, Excel and Google Sheets
Good analytical skills and a Can-Do mentality
You can perform on your own complex data analysis tasks with a focus on actionable insights for the underlying business case
You have experience (ideally 2+ years) in ecommerce, marketing, retail, wholesale, or similar areas
You have experience with at least one of the following topics: CLTV, Churn reduction, Dynamic pricing, Attribution, Mix-media models, Incrementality studies
Nice to have: (a) You have some experience with data visualizations tools such as powerBI, Tableau or Looker; (b) Python: pandas, scikit learn, etc. and (c) Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and similar tools




Your Role:

Support our clients with data analytics insights
Guide and oversee the prototype development of ML modules with our data science team
Guide and oversee the deployment of analytics modules with our data engineering team
Develop tailored BI reporting tools




What can you further expect from us:

Very interesting and challenging projects with leading international clients
An atmosphere of constant learning and improvement, as well as rewards for your contributions
Competitive salary and a monthly profit-sharing scheme
Very international environment
Being part in a highly motivated and outstanding talented team




Join our team and you can be on track to become a partner within 2 years.




Want to join us? Send us your CV!




Note:¬†We only consider your applications when you hold already a valid working visa for Germany.




Next steps in the hiring process are:

(1) a small challenge,

(2) an interview call,

(3) a personal interview at our office in Berlin,

and finally signing the contract and¬†making math rock! ;-)







PLEASE NOTE BEFORE YOU APPLY:

If your CV looks like a good potential fit for the position, we will asked you to solve a data challenge for us. This challenge is for us to verify that you are indeed an excellent fit for the position, it is not meant to be an education and training task. WE WILL NOT PROVIDE ANY DETAILED FEEDBACK TO YOUR CHALLENGE SOLUTION, if you are not selected to the next interview stage. Please understand that we don't have the resources to give every applicant detailed feedback on the solution. Our only objective is to identify the best candidates for the position. If you don't agree with our point of view here, please do not apply.

Title: Fullstack Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission

Others might refer to this unique role as a Business-oriented Data Engineer.

Are you passionate about diving deep into data, solving complex problems with clever logic, and working independently on robust data solutions? As a Fullstack Data Analyst, you will help bex gain a 360¬∞ view of activities and developments through data, creating the foundation for data-driven company management. You will be responsible for maintaining and further developing our existing data management and handling infrastructure, ensuring its continued reliability and effectiveness.

Your Responsibilities


Maintaining and gradually improving our existing data handling, reporting structures and management reports
Setting up governance for data quality, consistency, and trust in data handling
Keeping data pipelines healthy and adding new data sources to the Data Warehouse
Owning ETL processes for data from bexOS (our production system) and connected systems (support systems like Hubspot, finway or billomat)
Owning tool stack to handle data (esp. with Google Products like Cloud Scheduler, App Scripts, Cloud Functions, Big Query, ‚Ä¶), and setting up dynamic reports and dashboards (Google Looker Studio)
Adjusting dashboards as needed following data changes
Enabling teams to effectively use data via reporting tools in their daily work, empowering them to generate their own insights
Supporting business teams and product engineering squads in data handling, incl. providing use case and metrics-specific data sets
Managing defined KPI sets, ensuring data quality and providing documentation for such
Supporting the management team with plan/actual comparisons and the development of business cases
Gathering and structuring input and data related requests from business teams
Performing project based analysis tasks connected to company initiatives in collaboration with dedicated business teams, like operations, sales, marketing, finance or product management

Unique Aspects of the Role


You will be the sole member of the data team, which allows you to have a significant impact and take full ownership of the data infrastructure. Our plan is to staff the team over the period of 2 years with other positions.
You will closely collaborate with platform engineering and regular software developers, who focus on feature development.
You will report directly to and work closely with the VP of Platform, making this a unique position within the company.


Your profile

You are known for your cooperative and collaborative nature, always ensuring that coworkers are in the loop. You proactively seek to support and collaborate with others, not just when they are stuck, but also whenever they can lend a hand. With your humble nature and caring attitude, you foster trust and authenticity within the company.

Your ambition shines through in your constant pursuit of growth and understanding of the end results of your work. You are always open to feedback, eager to innovate, and actively share knowledge with the team.

You are straightforward in your approach, by being transparent and honest. Not only that, but you make decisions confidently, follow up diligently, and are authentic and proactive in your interactions. Furthermore, you are not afraid to address any tensions or issues directly, and take the lead in and responsibility for your actions.

Your curiosity is evident in your approach to unknowns and complexities. You see these as opportunities for growth and improvement. Your curiosity often leads you to new, innovative solutions.

Your Profile


"Getting it done" mentality, and strong communication skills
Demonstrated willingness to learn and grow
Analytical understanding and general curiosity in business performance and technical data handling
Experience with analytics, reporting, and dashboard tools, especially Google products (Google App Scripts, Google Cloud Functions, Google Looker studio, BigQuery, Looker Studio)
Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and prior work experience in connecting it via LowCode Tools like Zapier or other Google Products to facilitate simple data gathering use cases
Experience in using AI Assistance like ChatGPT or Copilot to enhance effectivity
Fluent in English, German is a plus


Technical Skills (summary)


SQL writing queries combining several datasets
Proficiency in Excel (beyond VLOOKUP)
Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and first experience in Google App Scripts
First experience with Python Code to write and manage data ETL processes

Title: Risk Intern - Data Analysis and BI (f/m/d)
Description:
Upvest, founded in 2017, enables any financial institution to offer great investment experiences to its customers. Upvest is an investment firm regulated by the German supervision authority (BaFin). The company currently employs 160+ people across Europe with its headquarters based in Berlin, Germany.

The company is backed by the world‚Äôs largest venture capital funds and investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Notion Capital, and ABN Amro Ventures, as well as by renowned fintech entrepreneurs (including Maximilian Tayenthal, founder of N26, and Felix Haas, founder of IDnow).

We‚Äôre looking for fintech enthusiasts to join us in creating the financial infrastructure of tomorrow. We‚Äôre building the first European Investment API to enable any financial institution offering a wide range of efficient and transparent investment products, such as stocks and ETFs in nominal, portfolio, and fractional form. Our mission and vision is to make investing as easy as spending money.




Your mission:

As a Risk Intern at Upvest, your mission will be to dive into various risk topics through conducting comprehensive impact assessments, refining internal risk models, and creating and maintaining dynamic BI dashboards. Your enthusiasm for solving complex problems will drive automation initiatives and support cross-functional data queries. With your analytical mindset and data-driven approach, you will ensure accurate modelling techniques and contribute to the development of robust market risk models, driving innovation in risk management while making a significant impact on our organisation‚Äôs resilience. Your contribution will empower the company to scale by driving data-driven decision-making and fostering strategic growth.




This role will give you the opportunity to:

Risk Model Management: Maintain and enhance our internal risk models using Python and SQL, designing and implementing enhancements to increase accuracy and broaden risk coverage.
Business Intelligence: Craft and refine dynamic dashboards, insightful reports, and alerts using Looker to boost data transparency and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) effectively.
Impact Assessments: Collaborate with other teams to conduct comprehensive impact assessments and calculate necessary collateral for potential clients, ensuring strategic decision-making.
Automation: Generate and implement creative ideas to automate risk analytics processes to enhance efficiency and accuracy, and explore new tools and technologies to bring the team to the next level.
ESG Scoring: Contribute to the development of robust Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) scoring metrics, promoting sustainable business practices.
FX Modeling: Engage in the development and refinement of FX models, driving informed financial strategies.
Research: Conduct thorough research and due diligence on various market-related topics to support data-driven decision-making and strategic initiatives.
Securities Onboarding: Partner with various departments to streamline the securities onboarding process for clients by conducting thorough risk assessments, communicating critical findings, and tracking the instrument onboarding.
Data Request Support: Utilise Looker, BigQuery, and Bloomberg to fulfil internal and cross-functional data requests, providing precise and actionable insights.




Job requirements:

Commitment to a 3 - 6 month full-time internship
Enthusiasm about fintech and investments and curiosity to learn more about risk management and data analysis at a BaFin-licenced investment firm
Bachelor/Master studies in Finance, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Economics with a quantitative focus
Skills in Python and SQL, or similar programming or database languages
Experience with Google CollabVBA or Google Apps Script a plus
Eagerness to learn and a passion for taking on new challenges
Curiosity for new technological developments which drives your pursuit of discovering and implementing innovative tools
A self starter with a strong sense of ownership for your work and an ability to iterate quickly
A team player who is excited about working with a diverse range of colleagues
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Willingness to relocate to Berlin (where our office is located) to experience the unique team culture at Upvest
Eligibility to work in Germany




Why Upvest?

We're working on solving a hard problem: fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest. You have the opportunity to contribute to this change.
We invest in you. From access to a personal coach, development budget and plenty of opportunities to grow in your role.
We take hiring seriously with a strong focus on keeping a high bar when interviewing (equally important is that we hire decent people, who are passionate about their craft and helping us achieve our shared mission).
While we're not quite fully-remote, we are committed to being a flexible employer, as we understand you don't have to be in the office to do your best work.
We live a culture of empowerment, trust (that we hire the best people and get out of their way) and openness (there's a greater advantage in sharing information than keeping it to ourselves).




Our values:

Learn and grow. We aim high to shape our future. We give and request honest feedback knowing that we develop together. Progression over Perfection.
Team first. We make it easy for others. We value our differences and are open to others' opinions. We win and celebrate together! Team over Egos.
Own the outcome. Whether we win or we lose, we stand together. We are proactive and get the job done. Outcome over Process.
Tell the story. We always start with the why. We share knowledge to empower others. Transparency over Complexity.




Upvest is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

In light of rapidly evolving and scaling up its development trajectory, Billie has recently set up a Portfolio Risk Management function. The main objective is to measure, control and drive decisions to optimize one of the core business metrics - portfolio losses. In order to do so, the team manages risk by researching and innovating, strategizing and recommending risk mitigating actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data (Risk) Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team and contribute to the development and enhancement of our portfolio risk management system.

In this role, you will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide risk decisions within the company values and expectations and be able to mitigate risks while at the same time embrace growth opportunities.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

Responsibilities


Perform in-depth portfolio data analysis from various angles (credit risk, fraud, acceptance rate and funnel) to develop a deep understanding of business processes and product, and to support risk optimisation
Design data models as part of data business warehouses to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update Portfolio management dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding portfolio performance, communicate key insights and recommendations to relevant stakeholders
Perform in-depth data analysis to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Identify and analyze potential sources of loss to minimize risk and estimate the potential financial consequences of a loss
Connect all business stakeholders in order to present portfolio‚Äôs KPIs and drive the business approach to managing risk
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have at least 3-4 years proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative risk analytics
You have excellent proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Experience in designing KPI dashboards for all types of audiences up to C-level
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You are proficient in data visualization and analytics tools, like Tableau, Power BI, Looker
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organised, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple responsibilities
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x) in the field of AI & Satellite Data
Description:
Build the Market Leader in Satellite Analytics with us at LiveEO

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our team. LiveEO leverages satellite imagery and artificial intelligence to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making across various industries. Examples are the precise detection of trees and their height in high resolution imagery to protect our customers power grids from tree fall, or the detection of dangerous construction work around critical infrastructure.

The successful candidate will join LiveEO‚Äôs AI team and will be a key contributor to the company‚Äôs effort to build state of the art geospatial AI models. The role involves building robust, automated and efficient data pipelines that transform terabytes of satellite data into ML-ready format for large scale model training.

You will have the ability to make a large personal impact on the development of the AI team and make significant contribution to foundational geospatial AI solutions of LiveEO. We don‚Äôt expect you to be an expert in all of the above but you should have the willingness to dive into new technical challenges and work on groundbreaking projects.

Tech Stack & Tools That We Are Using


Python: Rasterio, Numpy, PDAL, OSGEO, Geopandas, SQLAlchemy
Orchestration: Prefect, Anyscale/Ray
Databases: PostgreSQL, PostGIS
Infrastructure: Docker, AWS
GIS: QGIS, GDAL


Your challenge


Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines that efficiently handle large amounts of geospatial raster data
Orchestrate and automate data workflows using orchestration engines such as Prefect
Manage and optimize relational databases, ensuring data integrity and performance (experience with PostgreSQL, Snowflake preferred)
Engage in continuous improvement of the data processing frameworks by addressing challenges associated with large-scale Machine Learning pipelines and satelliate image processing, including data selection and observability, data and model versioning, automated data QA


Your profile


4+ years of experience in Data Engineering or a similar field
Experience in designing, building, and maintaining high-throughput data pipelines, with a strong background in handling large datasets, particularly raster data
Solid experience in designing, automating, implementing, and maintaining ETL pipelines
Experience with Python with a strong emphasis on writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code
Knowledge of parallel computing, including concurrent programming and performance optimization, to handle high-volume data processing tasks
A proactive approach to problem-solving, with a willingness to dive into and navigate challenging and broad topics, driving innovation to improve data quality and process efficiency
Understanding of geospatial and remote sensing data and processing techniques is a big plus
Hands on experience with tooling of Machine Learning Operations at large scale is a nice to have
Proficiency in managing relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Snowflake), with a strong understanding of database design and query optimization
You live in or you are willing to relocate to Berlin


Your Benefits


The opportunity to create a product that can improve business processes and lives across the globe
Flexible working hours and hybrid work model - we trust our employees to get their work done while maintaining a healthy work-life balance
We empower employees to drive their own career development, take initiative and have the freedom to be creative and bold
Not an overtime culture - we take care that overtime is done only as a necessity and always offset with time off and rest
Variety of team building opportunities - from jogging groups, team sports, bouldering and picnics
A collaborative and learning environment - frequent internal workshops, knowledge sharing sessions, journal clubs and hackathons
Office located in the centre of Berlin Kreuzberg with free fruit, nuts and drinks
Potential to participate in the employee stock option program
Urban Sports membership and BVG subsidy, corporate pension program
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 30+ different nationalities


About Us

LiveEO is a well funded startup founded in 2018 and based in Berlin. Our primary service is modelling risk to our customers‚Äô assets and infrastructure from vegetation, ground deformation and change detection.
